overview: I was born in Los Angeles, California. My family moved to rural Washington shortly there after. I grew up in Pullman, Washington. While in Pullman, I owned a skateboard and snowboard shop (TnT Skate and Snow) and two coffee shops (Java Llamas & Pony Espresso). I left Pullman in 1999 and moved back to Los Angeles. After about a year of managing a coffee shop in Hollywood I decided to move to Seattle. In Seattle I held numerous part-time jobs, but my primary interest was music. I started a small record label (Humble Rocks! Records), put out a number of records, and toured the country as the singer/songwriter/guitar player for the band Ultra Find (iTunes link). In 2004 I moved to Denver to return to college – thinking I might become an entertainment lawyer. In school I became very interested in the social sciences. I received a BA in Behavioral Science and then a MA in Sociology. During my undergraduate and graduate studies I started a web marketing and graphic design company called Luther Media. I also worked as a valet in the evenings. One night I got the idea to sell advertising on the blank side of valet tickets. It was then that I formed the company ValetAds. Also while working as a valet I met a very attractive attorney who I would soon marry. Through hanging out with her and her attorney friends I realized there was a huge need for a company that could address the web and media needs of lawyers. So in 2007 I formed a company called Law Father. Today, as my companies hum along I am working on a new business – CrowdShares.com. The promise of CrowdShares.com is to connect start-ups and small businesses to investors all over the country.
